resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

kszucs commented on issue #2487: ARROW-3131: [Go] add Go1.11 to the build matrix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2487#issuecomment-423157069
 
 
   > Since these builds are both pretty fast can you run them in the same CI entry?
   
   Would it be possible to run both versions in the same CI step? 
   We've implemented the rust nightly builds in a similar fashion in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2477.

sbinet commented on issue #2487: ARROW-3131: [Go] add Go1.11 to the build matrix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2487#issuecomment-431589153
 
 
   circling back...
   
   I couldn't figure out how to build for multiple Go toolchains, short of copy-pasting the stanza for each Go compiler:
   ```
     # Go
     - language: go
       go_import_path: github.com/apache/arrow
       os: linux
       go:
       - 1.10.x
       before_script:
       - if [ $ARROW_CI_GO_AFFECTED != "1" ]; then exit; fi
       script:
       - $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/travis_script_go.sh
       after_success:
       - pushd ${TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR}/go/arrow
       - bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash) || echo "Codecov did not collect coverage reports"
     # Go
     - language: go
       go_import_path: github.com/apache/arrow
       os: linux
       go:
       - 1.11.x
       before_script:
       - if [ $ARROW_CI_GO_AFFECTED != "1" ]; then exit; fi
       script:
       - $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/travis_script_go.sh
       after_success:
       - pushd ${TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR}/go/arrow
       - bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash) || echo "Codecov did not collect coverage reports"
   ```
   
   I'll just bump to `1.11.x` and call it a day.

----------------------------------------------------------------

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.
As GitHub hides the original diff on merge, it is displayed below for
the sake of provenance:

As this is a foreign pull request (from a fork), the diff is supplied
below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

diff --git a/.travis.yml b/.travis.yml
index 2115218dd8..bfb607fda0 100644
--- a/.travis.yml
+++ b/.travis.yml
@@ -263,7 +263,7 @@ matrix:
     go_import_path: github.com/apache/arrow
     os: linux
     go:
-    - 1.10.x
+    - 1.11.x

     - if [ $ARROW_CI_GO_AFFECTED != "1" ]; then exit; fi
     script:

fields.description:
Go-1.11 has been released.

we should start to test this new stable release.
